intro: Dianthera verticillata, commonly known as the spiral flower, is a striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which forms a spiral pattern of small white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are pinnately divided, adding to its ornamental appeal. Dianthera verticillata is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and landscapes.
